intro: [WRONG START] Hieracesium subthulense, commonly known as the Thulé hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to the Arctic and subarctic regions of Europe and North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous tiny florets. The plant typically grows in alpine and tundra habitats, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions with poor soil. Its leaves are basal, forming a rosette, and the stems are erect, bearing yellow to orange flowers. Hieracium subthulense is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions, making it a resilient species in its native range.
